SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.routing

Class Route

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.routing.Route
public final class Route extends Object
Represents a single route in the Jolt framework, pairing an HTTP method and a path pattern to a RouteHandler.

The path may contain parameter placeholders in the form {paramName:TYPE}, where TYPE can be int, double, or omitted (meaning a general string). For instance: 


 GET /users/{id:int}

Parameters are compiled into a regex Pattern, and any extracted parameter names are stored in paramNames for later use in the request context.

Example usage: 


 get("/users/{id:int}", ctx -> {
     int userId = ctx.path("id").asInt();
     // handle logic
     return "User " + userId;
 });
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Beaudin

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Route(String httpMethod, String path, RouteHandler handler)
    Constructs a new Route by analyzing the provided path for any parameter placeholders, compiling them into a regex, and storing the resulting Pattern and parameter names.

  • Constructor Details

    • Route

      public Route(String httpMethod, String path, RouteHandler handler)
      Constructs a new Route by analyzing the provided path for any parameter placeholders, compiling them into a regex, and storing the resulting Pattern and parameter names.
      Parameters:
      httpMethod - The HTTP method for this route (e.g., "GET").
      path - The route path, possibly containing placeholders (e.g., "/user/{id:int}").
      handler - The function to handle incoming requests matching this route.
